questions.question: What is a key benefit of forming weaving cooperatives?
Which pricing strategy involves adding a profit margin to the total cost of materials, labor, and overhead?
What is a common challenge faced by weaving cooperatives?
choices: Fair distribution of work and profits
questions.answer: Fair distribution of work and profits

questions.question: Which market typically values traditional designs for cultural and ceremonial purposes?
What is an important aspect of marketing handwoven products?
What is a key component of a business plan for a woven product?
Which of the following is NOT typically considered when calculating the cost of a woven product?
What is a potential benefit of selling woven goods online?
Which of the following is an example of a sustainable fiber for weaving?
What is the purpose of conducting market research for woven products?
choices: To determine the best weaving techniques
To identify potential customers and their preferences
questions.answer: To identify potential customers and their preferences

questions.question: What is a value proposition in the context of woven products?
choices: The time taken to weave a product
A statement summarizing why a customer would choose your product
The profit margin on each item
questions.answer: A statement summarizing why a customer would choose your product

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical step in forming a weaving cooperative?
What is the primary purpose of a pop-up market for student-made woven goods?
choices: To practice pricing and selling skills
questions.answer: To practice pricing and selling skills

questions.question: Which of the following is a key consideration when adapting traditional motifs for contemporary designs?
choices: Balancing tradition with modern market demands
questions.answer: Balancing tradition with modern market demands

questions.question: What role can apprenticeships with local master weavers play in economic development?
choices: Reducing the number of new weavers

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically included in a marketing strategy for woven goods?
What is a potential challenge of selling woven goods in tourist markets?
choices: Lack of interest in cultural products
Absence of tourists in the area

questions.question: Which of the following is an important aspect of sustainable weaving practices?
What is the purpose of including a break-even analysis in a weaving business plan?
choices: To determine the maximum possible profit
To calculate the point at which revenue equals costs
To set the highest market price
To estimate the number of competitors
questions.answer: To calculate the point at which revenue equals costs

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential benefit of e-commerce for weavers?
choices: Guaranteed sales to all website visitors

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of teaching basic weaving to community members?
choices: To create competition for established weavers
To reduce the value of handwoven goods
To preserve cultural heritage and skills
To eliminate the need for weaving cooperatives
questions.answer: To preserve cultural heritage and skills

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically a factor in pricing woven goods?
What is a key consideration when developing products for the tourist market?
Which of the following is a potential advantage of value-based pricing for woven goods?
choices: It always results in the lowest price
It can capture higher margins for unique items
It eliminates the need for market research
questions.answer: It can capture higher margins for unique items

questions.question: What role can government or NGOs play in supporting weaving as an economic development strategy?
choices: Providing training and market access support
Setting fixed prices for all woven goods
questions.answer: Providing training and market access support

questions.question: Which of the following is an important consideration when integrating traditional motifs in contemporary designs?
choices: Respecting cultural significance while appealing to modern tastes
Avoiding any changes to traditional patterns
questions.answer: Respecting cultural significance while appealing to modern tastes

questions.question: What is a potential benefit of conducting a collaborative project with a local textile cooperative?
choices: Reducing the number of individual weavers
Gaining practical experience and industry connections
questions.answer: Gaining practical experience and industry connections

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically a part of a weaver's brand identity?
What is the primary purpose of including financial projections in a weaving business plan?
choices: To estimate future income and expenses
To set fixed prices for all products
To determine the exact number of sales
questions.answer: To estimate future income and expenses

questions.question: Which of the following is a key consideration when preserving endangered weaving techniques?
choices: Focusing only on the most profitable techniques
Replacing all traditional methods with modern ones
Keeping techniques secret from younger generations
